page.title: 18HISTORIC BUILDINGS
page.content: Epperstone was the base of a{Roman {settlement}and villa and 1000 coins were found in 1776. The{Church}of the Holy Cross was referenced in Domesday Book 1086. The present Church was built between 1390 and 1450.It was reroofed and the spire repaired in 1978,the weather vane was regilded at a cost of Â£223. The{Primitive Methodist Chapel}was built in 1852 and is now used as the village institute.A Wesleyan Methodist Chapel is now disused. The{School}was built in 1852 and cost Â£1000,which was raised by public subscription and a Government.It is now a Primary School but this will close at the end of the year. A 17th century{sheepwash and pinfold and 2{dovecots}built about 1700 are all in good repair.
